name: dicklaurent
text: Let's discuss the tapping of the left hand.

name: alejandroadam
text: ocd, was my thought.

name: syrinx
text: I can't even figure out what he means.  Is he tapping his left hand with his right hand, or is he tapping his left hand against something else?  I'm a long way from solving this mystery :(

name: goocifer
text: This is actually a thing.  I used to sit next to a guy at work who would tap the base of his palm twice agianst the front of the desk, and then tap the tips of his fingers twice behind the mouse before being able to touch the mouse itself.  He had a number of other ticks and spasms, but this was the mouse related one.  It was a constant ballet of movement in my periphery, but I never wanted to ask him about it in case it was a medical condition rather than just habit.  I heard that he developed it his sophomore year of college, one semester he didn't twitch constantly, next semester he did.

name: spinynorman
text:
When I was at the library, there was one dude who would click constantly, and I mean god damned constantly no matter what page he was at. It was like he was scared the page was going to slip away, much like a canvas being blown by the wind, and he has to keep clicking on it to keep it down.

FUCK it was impossible to study next to his ass.

name: clintisiceman
text: That sounds like the kind of stuff I do without realizing it. It was maybe me. Sorry, dude.

name: sarmatron
text: Was he by any chance highlighting text? I used to do that with anything longer than a couple paragraphs. I still have no idea why. Killed quite a few good mice because of it.

name: daedala_x
text: But do you highlight and unhighlight at 23highlights/second? Twice I have seen people do this in my classes on their laptops while perusing their email or news-sites, all hell of A.D.D. I can just see the next generation being taught using blinking powerpoint presentations where the font and background colors switch off. All pupils darting up and down. All mouths foaming. All circle jerking the guy next to you getting hot to Heidegger.

name: goddessdictator
text: You have the best avatar. it is known. go david mack. go go go. You don't know me. no you dont.

name: goddessdictator
text: i have signed posters of his on my wall. just to add.

name: fermatprime
text:
I do this.

daedala_x, do you think it is rad to have ocd?

name: skavid
text: I actually sort of do this, sure it's not 23highltights/second but, I do have a habit of highlighting text over and over again when I am reading it. Also, I tend to read text conversations out loud immediately after I finish typing them.

name: redion
text: i totally do that on my laptop. the touchpad is fun. anyone reading over my shoulder is driven insane by my incessant highlighting.

name: dissembly
text:
I AM DOING THIS RIGHT NOW.

Actually I am typing right now, but as I was reading spinynorman's comment, it was all going highlighted, then unhighighted, then half-highlighted, then you have to highlight the *other* half to balance it out (otherwise you've highlighted too much on just one part of the paragraph).

FUUUUU-

name: saucy_jack
text: I do that a lot. I like clicking.

name: lucid
text:
I started to develop this habit for a while because if the window lost focus or you were focused on a text box within a page, the scroll wheel would not work properly.

But I taught myself to stop, because I kept accidentally clicking links, especially on pages that tag words but don't highlight them as links.

name: dybrar
text: Pro Starcraft player keeping his APM up in the off-season.

name: dusty
text: It sounds like obsessive behavior, it may stem from the procedure to neutralize static before working on a computer, though done to such an extent it is obviously more than is necessary.

name: libelandslander
text:
Dusty! I have now chubbied several of your comments in a row! You are a good commenter!
This was an informative comment.

name: implode
text:
You were worried that perhaps he had an allergy that prevented him from touching computer mice before he'd done a hand-tapping routine?
That's rad.

name: deimosrising
text: Did he ever hire the stripper? I want to know

name: spinynorman
text: I have noticed that the female models in the store are unreasonably sexy.

name: mikebox
text: I wouldn't say it's unreasonable

name: woodenteeth
text: If she isn't naked. It's unreasonable.

name: rayonatoilet
text: Ma'am, cease modeling that clothing. You are sexy and it is getting out of LINE.

name: delzhand
text:
Man, don't be lookin' in my-

Achewood makes me laugh out loud so often it's a wonder I didn't get fired from my last job.

name: geysershitdick
text: Fantastic Vlad monologue.

name: agika
text: Vlad would like to see something better when he looks into Roast Beef's windows, dammit.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Vlad spends the nights walking the sidewalks of the neighborhood, glancing in the windows he passes to see tableaus of other lives and other realities than his own. Vlad's driver's license is suspended.

name: charchar
text: Well, who wans spy on boring people? That's why ministers and royalty are always getting into trouble.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: sometimes it's the quietest people.........

name: connellingus
text: I love how practiced Vlad's speech sounds. The semicolon conveys that so well.

name: shoinan
text: Vlad is a robot made up of many subroutines. In other words, he is a complicated robot.

name: cailetshadow
text:
He's got complicated subrouthines but one thing on his mind...

Vlad!

name: tttt
text: A comment left by tttt was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by KaMeT, equinn2006, snoozebar, PoodleLucy)

name: darthemed
text: Boo to that!

name: saucy_jack
text: How do you know that a robot's ass is bad?

name: catgrl131
text: IT MUST BE!

name: ford
text:
WHY FIND-

No, i can't. *sob*

name: troy_convers
text: It's in the liner notes to Rubber Soul.

name: troy_convers
text: Why find out

name: tttt
text: PS i felt my mouth dry up and crumble to dust at the thought of Beef's sandwich of choice

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Interesting that he would bother to make that a sandwich, rather than just eating some bread and then some saltines.

name: bixschmix
text: Now try to whistle.

name: daedala_x
text: The sandwich was probably not all that dry since roast beef drew a :( onto each saltine with shiracha chili sauce before assembling and eating it.

name: johnnybaverage
text: I actually gagged a little upon reading the sandwich thing. Unpleasant, to say the least.

name: nicolae
text: Unless he applies the showercap to the keyboard itself I don't think it would do much good.

name: tekende
text: He might. I guess if it was a transparent cap you could still use the keyboard. This idea intrigues me.

name: yingkaixing
text: Beef has been typing for most of his life. He does not need to see the keyboard to type miles and miles of code.

name: stormagnet
text: He doesn't need the shower cap for the keyboard; it's already covered by the Giant Condom.

name: cailetshadow
text: Vlad: Wise friend to terrifyingly thorough voyeur in 20 seconds.

name: c_dizzle
text: The second T says "..Vlad's here..." I knew everything was going to be OK.

name: tekende
text: I cannot get over the idea of the imaginary airport on arm of couch. It's just...it's funny in a very subtle way.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Yes. He is robot knowink exactly how human children create tableaux for playink. He should write advice column also.

name: soticoto
text: Vlad watches you out of genuine concern for your wellbeing... with a sprig of awesome.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text:
In one of our dining halls there's this guy who always double taps your id before he swipes it through the reader. He's a funny looking blond guy and he always smiles real big and wears dress shirts and weird ties and everyone calls him 'Happy Dave'.

Although I suppose I just revealed that I'm a college student.

name: epicurus
text: A college student, eh? Now that you've narrowed the field, me and the rest of the internet will make with the identity theft. By this time tomorrow you'll be in Thailand making love to Bob Sapp to pay off your credit card debts.

name: drago25
text: Vlad you observant boy.

name: m3funkyb
text: he probably still does that business

name: ham_shoes
text: Beef can object all he wants but Vlad will NOT BE STOPPED

name: wallabeechamp
text: I think there needs to be a greater emphasis on the strippers who model! The idea is so ironicly great, music is coming out of my ears!

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ugh. seriously. windows work both ways and i don't get why people look at you dirty for only using them in the other direction. i got mad curiosity! i have to solve it. like, if you don't want people to look, cover them or remove them. again; ugh. seriously.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: the quietest people...

name: samspud
text: Five for heppy.
